content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at position(x=5.0, y=5.0)

Use-case: Converts iron ore (with coal) into iron plates needed for subsequent production processes.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)

Use-case: Converts copper ore (with coal) into copper plates to supply essential materials for further component production.


ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Misuse: Calls to get_entities must follow the exact signature. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extra positional arguments to prevent TypeErrors.

• Data Iteration Safety: Before iterating over the results from get_entities, verify that the returned value is a valid list rather than None to prevent “NoneType” iteration errors.

• Inventory and Placement Verification: Ensure that required items (for example, a Lab) are present in the inventory before attempting placement on the map. This avoids errors related to missing inventory during placement.

• Sub-Component Resource Chain: Validate that all dependencies for lab production—such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables—can be produced with available raw materials and processing structures. Addressing shortages in these sub-ingredients helps prevent cascading crafting failures.
